result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron A Sally was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF239.

Sentencing Hearing held 11/17/14

Defendant Aaron A Sally in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Aaron A Sally in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CF-239, 14CF-8, 14CF-235, 14CF-240 and 14CF-290.

1:37 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are scheduled for a sentencing hearing at this time.
Defendant entered pleas earlier.
Court ordered a PSI be prepared.

Both parties received a copy of the PSI.
State has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty McFarland shared this with his client, has a number of corrections to state from a factual standpoint.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court, the crime lab split up the weight.
Atty McFarland continues with addressing corrections.
 
Court received a letter, forwarded from Atty McFarland that was authored by Shanesia Logan, Defendant's aunt.
Atty Molepske received a copy of this letter as well.

State did give notice to Ms. R, victim notification statutes. Ms. R is not in the courtroom.

Neither party will be calling witnesses.

State addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes recommendations.
Atty McFarland addresses the Court prior to sentencing, requests an imposed and stayed sentence or a 2 year initial confinement and 4-5 years extended supervision.
Court questions on pretrial incarceration credit.
Atty McFarland addresses credit: 13CF-239 - 183 days; 14CF-8 - 208 days; 14CF-240 - 133 days; 14CF-235 - 133 days; 14CF-290 - 106 days.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court takes a moment to review the files.
Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

13CF-239 
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 10 Years
Initial Confinement for 4 Years
Extended Supervision for 6 Years
Concurrent to all other sentences
183 Days Credit
Eligible for Challenge Incareration and Eligible for Earned Release after 4 Years
Conditions:
Pay costs
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision
Maintain absolute sobriety
Get all medications from same pharmacy
Sign all necessary releases to monitor 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not have any contact with anyone possessing or consuming controlled substances
Court will allow contact with S.R. only with approval by the department
Go to school full time, work full time or a combination thereof
Continue with AODA treatment at the direction of the Dept of Corrections
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent

Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 3 Years
Initial Confinement for 1  Year 6 Months
Extended Supervision for 1 Year 6 Months
Concurrent to all other sentences
183 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision

14CF-8:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 10 Years
Initial Confinement for 5 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
Concurrent to 13CF-239
308 Days Credit
Eligible for Challenge Incareration and Eligible for Earned Release after 4 Years
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-239
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision

14CF-235:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 6 Years
Initial Confinement for 3 Years
Extended Supervision for 3 Years
Concurrent to all sentences imposed on this day
Not eligible for Earned Release and Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration
133 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-239 and 14CF-8
Pay costs 
Pay DNA Surcharge
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision

14CF-240:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 6 Years
Initial Confinement for 3 Years
Extended Supervision for 3 Years
Concurrent to all other sentences imposed on this day
133 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-239, 14CF-8 and 14CF-235 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision

14CF-290:
Count 3:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 6 Years
Initial Confinement for 3 Years
Extended Supervision for 3 Years
Concurrent to all other sentences imposed on this day
106 Days Credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-239, 14CF-8, 14CF-235 and 14CF-240
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
25% taken out of prison account, balance due while on supervision

Atty McFarland addresses the Court with regards to contact with S.R.
Court will change condition.

Parties will keep their copies of the PSI, to be kept confidential.
Appeal rights are addressed.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron A Sally in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Aaron A Sally in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard today are 13CF239, 14CF8, 14CF235, 14CF240 and 14CF290.
1:53 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Molepske states that an amended information had been filed and defense attorney had received a copy.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court states that received Pre-Trial Supervison by e-mail and both State and Defense received also.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF239 (amended information to be filed):
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI

14CF8:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

14CF235:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

14CF240 (amended information filed today):
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

14CF290:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court changed date on Plea Questionnaire to reflect the actual date signed by the defendant and initials change.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Molepske states that victim notification had been completed on 14CF8.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 on 13CF239, Count 1 on 14CF8, Count 1 on 14CF235, Count 1 of 14CF240 and Count 3 of 14CF290 all other counts are DRI.
PSI Ordered.
Sentencing Hearing set for November 17, 2014 at 1:30 p.m. 
Court orders bond revoked.

Court asks both parties to make sure they verify pre-trial incarceration determined at time of sentencing.

Judicial Review Request 6/25/14 az

Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-8 for a Jury Trial  and 13CF-239 for a status conference.

8:52 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant has failed to appear.
The Jury has assembled and this Court had every reason to believe, up until this morning that Defendant was going to be present. 
Court received a letter from the person who posted the bond, indicating that Defendant may  have left the state.

Atty Schmidt has not heard from Defendant.

Court apologizes to the jurors for the inconvenience. This was a felony matter involving a number of charges including with possession with intent to deliver.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a bench warrant, body only.
All monies posted are ordered forfeited.

Atty Molepske concurs with the order of the Court.

8:54 AM Jurors are excused.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Sarah Rajski.

Defendant Aaron A Sally in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. Defendant Aaron A Sally in custody. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:03 am. Court calls case.
DA Molepske states appearances.

Court indicates Motion was commenced last week and the State was allowed time to file another Motion.
Parties have Stipulated to five convictions.
Court makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders that the charge not be severed and both counts go to trial together.
Motion for severance is denied.

Atty Molepske makes statements in regards to 13CF239.
State makes arguments in support of motion.
Atty Schmidt makes statements in objection to the State's motion.
State replies to arguments.
Court makes statements.
Court cites case law.

BY THE COURT:
Court does not think the facts are similar. 
Court does not allow the State to use the evidence.

Atty Schmidt requests bond be reduced to a $2,000 cash bond.
Atty Schmidt states Defendant will reside with his brother Ray Sally.
State agrees with bond modification.
State requests no contact with victim.
Court questions the State if the victim was given notice of the motion hearing.
Court states anytime there is a consideration of bond the victim should be present.

BY THE COURT:
Bond will not be notified today.
Trial would go forward next week.

State indicates the Court they will be filing amended information.
Sara Rajski is now in court.
Court indicates parties are to be back in court at 1pm.

1:09 pm. Court is back in session.
Same appearances as before.
Court wants to confirm charges being dismissed or amended.
State will be dismissing Ct 2 and amending Ct 4.
Court questions Ms. Rajski.
State makes statements in regards to bond.

BY THE COURT:
Court will modify the bond.

Atty Schmidt requests defendant pay cash bond with wage assignment.
Court does not approve a wage assignment.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Introduction of Other Acts Evidence Pursuant to 904.04(2) filed by the State
Motion hearing on June 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Aaron A Sally in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. Defendant Aaron A Sally in custody. Louis J Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Molepske indicates the defendant will not be entering a plea today.  
Atty Schmidt asks for motion dates to be set. 
Court questions parties if they would like to proceed with the motions today. 
Atty Molepske makes statements re: motions he will be filing.  State did not file it's other acts motion which is the only other motion the state seeks to entire that will require time.  Not prepared to do that one today but could do the other motions today. 

Motion for Severance: 
Atty Schmidt makes arguments in support of motion for severance. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 
Atty Schmidt makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Matter has not been briefed or had any legal analysis in writing by either party, Court will provide an answer at a later date. 

Court notes there is a Speedy Trial Demand.  If the jury trial does not go on the 22nd, it will not be met.   Court advises Atty Schmidt to speak with the Judges in Wood County to reschedule trials there. 

Atty Schmidt indicates defendant will be working at Golden County Foods. Will be living with his brother. 
Court notes neither the employer nor the brother are here to verify.  Trial is set for the 25th and 26th of June. 
Atty Schmidt confers with his client. 

State alleges 5 convictions. 
Atty Schmidt does not dispute the 5 convictions. 

971.31(3) Statements of the Defendant. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments in support of this motion. 
Court question if challenging admissibility of statements. 
Atty Schmidt does not believe so.  If trying to admit through other people, then would be hearsay issue. 
Court will have to rule on that issue, if and when it happens. 
Atty Schmidt makes statements re: hearsay. 
BY THE COURT:  Admitted subject to the hearsay rules.

Atty Molepske makes motion to use expert testimony at trial. 
Atty Schmidt makes additional statements subject to right to object for foundation. 

Other acts motion is being filed at this time.  Copy should be given to the Court.  

Court notes 14CF8 is being tried.  The 13CF239 case had the speedy trial demand dropped. 
  Motion hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Aaron A Sally in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
2:11 p.m. is called and appearances stated on the record. 13CF29 and 14CF8
This is a motion hearing.
Attorney Schmidt makes statement as to its position and recent filing of motion on Friday.
The bond motion will be heard today.
Attorney Schmidt requests a signature bond.  Would like to be employed at Golden Country Foods.  Victim has signed waiver and would like contact.  Victim is also present in the courtroom.  
Currently set with a $5000 cash bond in 14CF8 with no contact with victim, Sarah Rajski.  Requests amended to signature bond and remain no contact provision.
DA makes statement re: $500 cash bond in 13CF239 and bond currently set in 14CF8.  Victim wrote several letters (3).  DA asks no contact provision remain.  Indicates there is a safety plan in place with DA's office.  Opposition to change in cash bond.  

Court questions the defendant's attorney re: probation.  
Defense attorney makes statement including defendant was in custody since December 23, 2013.  
Court questions the defendant's record.  DA indicates the following matters:  09CF281, 07CM514, 07CM328, 06CM371, 05CF259.  Defendant has been in custody since 12/23/2013 and was picked up in November by Ms. Rajski.  

Court states there is insufficient information to modify the bond and lack of a plan to do modification. 

BTC:
Modification of bond -  denied.
